classFeatures.name: Spellcasting
entries: An event in your past has left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with arcane magic. This font of magic, unlike that of a Sorcerer, originates from the soul. It fuels your spells and augments soul with additional power.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the soulborne spell list. You learn an additional soulborne cantrip of your choice at 4th level and another at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Soulborne table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these soulborne spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell burning hands} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell burning hands} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level spells of your choice from the soulborne spell list.

You learn an additional soulborne spell of your choice at each level except 12th, 14th, 16th, 17th, 18th, and 20th. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the soulborne spells you know and replace it with another spell from the soulborne spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your soulborne spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a soulborne spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You have a trinket that is infused with a portion of your soul, which can be used as an Arcane Focus for your spell casting. It should be visible at all times.

classFeatures.name: Anima Economy
entries: With your Arcane prowess growing, your control over your soul grows. While any other person's soul is a singular entity, the Soulborne's soul has grown beyond this constraint. Instead of a single entity, the Soulborne's soul is supplemented by Anima - which are additional fragments of souls that orbit the core entity. These Anima become an additional daily resource for the Soulborne.

entries.name: Anima
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your soul's form shifts to being an entity with a force of its own. The core entity of the soulborne's soul develops its own gravitational pull, increasing as you grow in power, that can hold a number of additional soul fragments called Anima.

At 2nd level, your soul has the power to hold four Anima. The maximum amount of Anima available to you increases by two at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 19th level. The table below shows the number of Anima available to you.

entries.name: Chromatic Soul
entries: Soulborne Sorcerers are able to change the colour of their soul on the magical spectrum, allowing them to tap into spells based on the chosen colour.

Starting at 1st level, you gain master of your soul, allowing you to spend a Bonus Action to switch your soul's colour. Switching your colour allows you to cast the following spells at their listed Anima cost instead of a spell slot.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis that alters the evolution of your soul. Your choice grants branching paths at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Soul Crush
entries: Starting at 17th level, you become a master at reading the souls of your foes in an instant, knowing exactly how to inflict damage to their essence. Target a creature within 60ft and crush their very essence into dust. At the cost of 6 Anima, the targeted creature must make a Constitution check against your Spell Save DC. The creature takes 7d8 + 24 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. You may only use this ability once per encounter. You cannot empower this ability with additional Anima. This ability does not affect creatures without a living soul, such as Constructs.

classFeatures.name: Master Manipulator
entries: At 20th level, STUFF HAPPENS.

subclassFeatures.name: Adaptive Soul
entries: Through external strife and conflict, the Adaptive soulborne has spent their entire life thus far willing themselves to be someone else in an attempt to fit in with their surroundings. A survival trait that, in anyone else, would be simply a useful tool has taken hold within the Soulborne's very core and changed how their abilities evolve and manifest. This type of soulborne does not have complete, willful control over their abilities, and are instead rule by emotion.
You also gain the Feature: Adaptive Path, which adds to your Reactive Soul feature at each level where you gain an Adaptive Soul feature

entries.name: Soul Link
entries: FLUFF

entries.name: Reactive Soul
entries: A side effect of the Adaptive Soul is the sway of emotions that dictate their path. Their abilities come from emotional stimuli more often than their willful intent.
Starting at 3rd level, when the creature with which you share the Soul Link is attacked, your emotional response manifests into missiles of Arcane energy.
This feature may only happen if you have not already used a Reaction, and can only occur once per round when the first attack roll is made but before the result of the roll is given by the GM.
